sentences.en: Arguably, both are involved in wilderness preservation.
sentences.cn: 有争议的问题是, 公共商品或外在化商品都隐人了荒野保护的问题中.

sentences.en: Being lost in the wilderness for a week was an ordeal for me.
sentences.cn: 在荒野里迷路一星期对我来说真是一场磨难.

sentences.en: Dangers lurk in the path of wilderness.
sentences.cn: 在这条荒野的小路上隐伏着危险.

sentences.en: Education in the wilderness is not a matter of monetary means.
sentences.cn: 荒凉地区的教育不是钱财问题.

sentences.en: He is proud of the garden he made from a wilderness.
sentences.cn: 他为自己从荒地上开辟出的花园而感到自豪。

sentences.en: He was sent barefoot wearing only a hair shirt into the wilderness as a penance.
sentences.cn: 为了赎罪，他跣足褐衣，被流放到了荒野中。

sentences.en: Jesus went out into the wilderness to think alone.
sentences.cn: 耶稣走进荒野去独自思考.

sentences.en: She drove the herd of cattle through the wilderness.
So few men were present to derange the harmony of the wilderness.
sentences.cn: 极少有人去扰乱林子里的平静.

sentences.en: The Antarctic is the world's last great wilderness.
sentences.cn: 南极洲是世界上最後一個大荒原。

sentences.en: The wilderness campsite had its own peculiar enchantment.
sentences.cn: 野营地有其自身独特的魅力。

sentences.en: These individuals'desire for wilderness preservation converts wilderness areas into public goods.
sentences.cn: 这些保护荒野的人们的愿望是把荒野区域转变成公有物.

sentences.en: They cleaved a path through the wilderness.
sentences.cn: 他们在荒野中打通一条路.

sentences.en: They may be considered as having a so - called " option demand " for wilderness.
sentences.cn: 他们可能会被认为对荒野具有 所谓 的 “ 选择权要求 ”.

sentences.en: Where, in the wilderness called living, had he lost his way?
sentences.cn: 在那叫做“生活”的旷野里, 他是在什么地方迷了路?

phrases.tran_cn: 无人理睬的改革主张（见《马太福音》3：3等）
在野的；荒原；离开政界的

trans.tran_en: A wilderness is a desert or other area of natural land which is not used by people
